original: pa lang kar gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: pa lang kar gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble one who has gone to Lanka.

original: sngags kyi tshig 'di dag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig 'di dag bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain these mantra words.

original: tadya th'a / aom padme padme de bee /
analyzed: tadya th'a / aom padme padme de bee /

original: hi ne hi ne /🔽tsu lu cu lu tsu lu /
analyzed: hi ne hi ne / tsu lu cu lu tsu lu /

original: hu le hu le hu le /🔽yu le yu le yu le /
analyzed: hu le hu le hu le / yu le yu le yu le /

original: pa le pa le pa le /
analyzed: pa le pa le pa le /

translated: if any son or daughter of noble family upholds,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la sngags kyi tshig 'di dag 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed na lha'am /🔽lha mo'am / klu 'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la sngags kyi tshig 'di dag 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed na lha'am / lha mo'am / klu 'am /
translated: carries, reads, and masters these mantra words, whether they are male or female gods,

original: gnod sbyin mo'am /🔽lha ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo'am / lha ma yin nam /

original: lha ma yin mo'am /🔽nam mkha' lding ngam /
analyzed: lha ma yin mo'am / nam mkha' lding ngam /

translated: or a great nāga, or a nāga woman,
or a gandharva, or a gandharva woman,
or a bhūta, or a bhūta woman,

original: grul bum mam; grul bum mo'am /🔽sha za'am / sha za mo'am /
analyzed: grul bum mam; grul bum mo'am / sha za'am / sha za mo'am /
translated: or a kumbhāṇḍa, or a kumbhāṇḍa woman,🔽or a piśāca, or a piśāca woman,

original: gnon po'am / gnon po mo'am /🔽brjed byed dam /
analyzed: gnon po'am / gnon po mo'am / brjed byed dam /
translated: or a pūtana, or a pūtana woman,🔽or an apasmāra,

original: srin po'am / srin mo'am /🔽phra men pho'am /
analyzed: srin po'am / srin mo'am / phra men pho'am /
translated: or a rākṣasa, or a rākṣasī,
or a piśāca, or a piśācī,🔽or a bhūta, or a bhūtā,
or a pūtanā, or a pūtanī,
or a kṛtya, or a kṛtyā,

original: mi'am / mi ma yin pa de dag thams @139b kyis glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: mi'am / mi ma yin pa de dag thams @139b kyis glags mi rnyed do //
translated: or a human, or a non-human, will not find an opportunity.

original: gsang sngags kyi tshig 'di dag klog par byed pa des lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo thams cad bklags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshig 'di dag klog par byed pa des lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo thams cad bklags par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting these mantra words, one will have read the entire Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra.

original: sngags kyi tshig 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis srin po la sogs pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis srin po la sogs pa rnams bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: These mantra words were spoken by the Blessed One in order to ward off rākṣasas and so forth.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo thams cad bklags par 'gyur ba'i gzungs sngags rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo thams cad bklags par 'gyur ba'i gzungs sngags rdzogs so ////
translated: The dhāraṇī mantra that is equivalent to reading the entire noble Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra is complete.
